Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 13th overall pick, by Ashburn in 1966...
Traded from Ashburn to Wisconsin on 3/2/1966 (Going to Ash: P N. Oneil. Going to WIS: CF C. Durante)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1970, off Ronald Hearn (Min)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/4/1970, off Bob Gleich (MAN)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Centerfield in 1970...
Injured on 9/25/1971 with a Strained Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 6 weeks...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Centerfield in 1971...
Won World Championship with Wisconsin in 1972...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Centerfield in 1972...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1973, hitting .520 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Pittsburgh on 10/9/1973...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Centerfield in 1973...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Plum Grove on 8/10/1974...
Traded from Wisconsin to Gashouse on 1/31/1975 (Going to GHG: P D. Terrill, C A. Hughs, CF C. Durante. Going to WIS: P D. Harnden, P F. Prahl, P G. Lerma, RF S. Stiltner, 1B C. Coll)...
Injured on 5/24/1975 with a Torn Groin Muscle, out for full season...
Injured on 5/8/1976 with a Inflamed Abdominal Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1976...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Syracuse on 8/6/1978...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Centerfield in 1978...
Signed as a free agent by Longport on 2/7/1981 to a 3-year deal worth $1,755,556 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Penn on 2/5/1984 to a 2-year deal worth $1,250,000 per year...
Had 2000th career hit on 5/30/1985, off Dennis Thompson (PON)...
